original: Bergholtz, Olof August, borgmästare, Växjö, f. 13/12/04 i Västervik av trävaruhandl. A. Jonsson o. Selma Bergholtz. G. 34 m. Karin Bengtsson. Barn: Inga f. 38, Gunnar 43. — Jur. kand. 27. Tf. fiskal i Svea hovr. 32, assessor 38, adv:fiskal 39, rev:sekr. 44, hovr :råd 45, borgmäst. i Växjö sed. 46. Led. av Kronob. 1. mödrahjälpsnd, ordf. i styr. f. Kronob. 1. sparb., led. av drätsieilkamm. i Växjö. Skr.: Barn-biidrag o. bidragsförskott (40). RNO.
translated: Bergholtz, Olof August, mayor, Växjö, born on December 13, 1904 in Västervik to timber merchant A. Jonsson and Selma Bergholtz. Married in 1934 to Karin Bengtsson, with two children: Inga, born in 1938, and Gunnar, born in 1943. Graduated with a law degree in 1927. Served as acting assistant prosecutor in Svea Court of Appeal in 1932, became an assessor in 1938, and an advocate prosecutor in 1939. He was appointed as secretary of revenue in 1944 and court adviser in 1945. Bergholtz became mayor of Växjö in 1946. He was a member of the board of the "Kronoberg County Maternity Help Association", chair of the board of the 1st Kronoberg County Savings Bank, and a member of the finance committee in Växjö. He wrote "Child support and maintenance advance payments" (1940). Received the Royal Order of the North Star.

structured.name: Olof August Bergholtz
structured.description: Olof August Bergholtz was a Swedish Mayor born on December 13, 1904 in Västervik, Sweden. He was married to Karin Bengtsson in 1934 and had two children, Inga and Gunnar. Bergholtz graduated with a law degree in 1927 and went on to serve as various legal positions including Acting Assistant Prosecutor, Assessor, Advocate Prosecutor, Secretary of Revenue, and Court Adviser. Bergholtz was appointed as Mayor of Växjö in 1946 and was a member of various organizations including the Kronoberg County Maternity Help Association, 1st Kronoberg County Savings Bank, and the Finance Committee in Växjö. He wrote a book entitled 'Child support and maintenance advance payments'. Bergholtz received the Royal Order of the North Star.
